name: No-Knead Cinnamon Rolls
author: Stephanie Knewasser
summary: These are gobbled up as soon as family sees them. I'll never try another cinnamon roll recipe, because I think these are the best. Note: These are wonderful fresh, but they don't freeze well.
directions: In saucepan, heat 1/2 cup milk, water, and 2 tablespoons butter until very warm
Place milk mixture, salt, flour, yeast, sugar, and eggs in the pan of the bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer
Select the Dough cycle
Press Start
Once Dough cycle is complete, remove the dough from the bread machine and punch down
On a floured surface, roll into a large rectangle
Smear with the softened butter
Combine the cinnamon and 1/3 cup sugar
Sprinkle over the rectangle
Generously sprinkle the raisins and/or chopped nuts over the top
Roll the dough up into a log starting at the long side
Cut into 12 slices
Place the rolls cut side down into a 9x13-inch greased baking pan
Cover, and let rise in a warm place until almost doubled, about 30 minutes
Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Combine the confectioners' sugar, 1
5 tablespoons melted butter, vanilla extract, and 1
5 tablespoons milk into a thick frosting; set aside
Bake rolls in preheated oven until golden, 20 to 25 minutes
Remove and allow to cool 10 minutes
Spread frosting over baked rolls and enjoy
